title: TSP-40-SubmitTicketDetails Request Schema
description: Schema for TSP to supply RMP with details about the ticket(s) it has booked following a booking request from RMP. The TSP may send this message multiple times for a single booking request but a specific traveller must only be included in one message i.e. The TSP should wait until they have the full set of fulfilment details for a traveller before including them in a message.

requestId.description: This is the unique return id created by HO when the request was first submitted by HO to TSP

reference.description: Home Office Reference. This should not be used as a unique Id as for a Family/Group Booking this will be shared by multiple travelers

createdBy.description: Details of the logger from TSP who is fulfilling the request

createdDateTime.description: The time the request is created by CWT. Format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

bookingDetails.description: The TSP can submit details over a number of messages. It may also include travellers not listed in the original request - see handlingGuidelines.awaitEscortNames in TSP-20 request schema for more information.

unassociatedItineraryRemarks.description: Unassociated itinerary remarks, display at the bottom of the itinerary

createdByDefinition.description: Basic contact details of the TSP Logger actioning this request

name.description: Name of the TSP logger who fulfilled the request and created the booking

groupName.description: TSP Group name to contact if named contact not available.

groupCode.description: Code of the TSP contact group.

groupEmail.description: Email address of the TSP contact group.

groupTelephone.description: Phone number of the TSP contact group.

bookingID.description: Booking ID OR Itinerary Number issued by the GDS (Global distribution systems - travel networking systems used by travel agencies)

flightDetailsDefinition.description: This will have record per traveller

totalPrice.description: The total cost for the ticket, including applicable taxes etc.

priceCurrency.description: ISO 4217 currency codes e.g. GBP, USD, INR etc

personnelType.description: Personnel type suggests the kind of travelers being booked as part of this booking

locatorCode.description: The Computer reservation system (CRS) creates a Record Locator also know as a PNR (Passenger Name Record) OR Booking Reference

firstName.description: Traveller's forename including any middle name

from.description: The starting leg of the journey

to.description: The last leg of the journey

totalPrice.description: The total cost for the ticket, including applicable taxes etc.

priceCurrency.description: ISO 4217 currency codes e.g. GBP, USD, INR etc

segmentDefinition.description: Details of a flight segment i.e. a plane taking off to landing. A ticket may cover one segment - or multiple segments where the journey is non-direct.

airlineCode.description: The airline operating this flight e.g. AA

airlineName.description: The airline operating this flight e.g American Airlines (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_airline_codes)

url.description: Web page to do the web check-in or manage the booking

departureDateTime.description: The date time when the flight departs. Local time is assumed. Do not include timezone information in the value. Format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

arrivalDateTime.description: The date time when the flight arrives. Local time is assumed. Do not include timezone information in the value. Format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

airportCode.description: The IATA code for the airport. e.g. LHR

airportName.description: A human friendly name for the airport corresponding to the given IATA code e.g. London Heathrow

terminal.description: The Terminal of the flight if known

eTicketNumber.description: This is issued by the Airlines and also referred as travel document's identifier e.g. 016-1246781231

fareType.description: Age Category of the traveller. Adult, Child or Infant

fareBasisCode.description: Airline assigned Letters and numbers that help identify the class of travel and traveller type e.g.'Y' represents full-fare Economy class and if the last two characters are CH than it's Child fare
